Technical Contribution: Significant technical contribution to area of responsibility
Requirements & Design: Accountable for overall technical designs for a project; influences and approves overall architecture; ensures design is reviewed.
Coding, Testing, & Debugging: Accountable for overall code quality; ensures code is reviewed, reusable and testable, meeting architectural-design and customer requirements
Performance & Availability: Accountable for overall performance and availability; defines metrics and sets targets for project.
Data Driven Process: Champions systems and project metric collection, analysis, and utilization to improve quality and efficiency; actively participates in the design and planning of workflow and pipelines.
Risks & Dependencies: Oversees all internal and external project dependencies and critical paths; ensures contingency plan is in place; recommends solutions and approves plan and timelines; understands overall impact on all stakeholders.
Planning & ROI: Identifies gaps in plans; approves project plans; provides cost-effective solutions and directions todifficult problems; answers what-if questions; validates staff competencies.
Team Development: Participates in identifying career opportunities and growing capabilities; acts as staff advocate and assesses morale for the team; takes advantage of opportunities to recruit talent; shares wins and successes; drives engagement; accountable for performance plans and promotions,
Sphere of Influence:
Manages and provides direction for a small team, explains challenges to, and can build concensus within, the function
Interacts frequently with senior internal employees and external representatives on significant matters concerning functional operatoins, scheduling of projects
Communication: Represents the organization as a prime contact on initiatives and projects Conducts briefings and technical meetings for internal and external representatives Develops strong relationships and serve as a trusted advisor within the team
Accountability: Accountable for all technology/technical function on a large project or several small projects, accountable for quality of customer experience
Impact:
Work directly impacts function's goals and objectives and may have cross-functional impact
Makes recommendations to management on matters relating to human resources, budget and department operations
Drive for Results: Clarifies ambiguity and directs team; mentor for junior staff; goes above and beyond to complete tasks and get the job done right,work is reviewed and measured based on meeting objectives and schedules
Passion / Innovation: Leads innovation in critical products or technologies; highly creative problem solver
Key Incremental Competencies: Building effective teams; decision quality; developing direct reports; drive for results; managing and measuring work
Direction: Work is performed under limited direction, establishes own work priorities and timelines. Accomplishes results through subordinate tech leads and engineers, spending at least 30% - 50% of  time managing and providing guidance to subordinates within the latitude of established company policies .  Responsible for the staffing and development direct reports, and may provide guidance and coordinate the work activities of other employees
Decisionmaking:
Exercises judgment in deciding which method or techniques to use to obtain departmental results
Makes independent decisions within guidelines which have short-term team impacts and limited impact on long-term results
May recommend changes to policies which effec the team
